subject: Re: I need technical support
preview: Thanks for waiting. We've completed the repair of the infected site.  There were several malicious files found within the site that I've moved to private/suspected. * Your plugin 'schema' was infected

action.text: Rica Rosario Valencia marked as Closed

full_threads.body:
Thanks for waiting. We've completed the repair of the infected site.

There were several malicious files found within the site that I've moved to private/suspected.

* Your plugin 'schema' was infected. I reinstalled it from the WordPress repository at version 1.7.9.4

As a precaution, I have reset the site's SFTP and Database passwords. Additionally, any old backups containing Malware have been removed from the site. I've taken a manual backup for you of the clean-state of the site in case you need to restore it.

There are some action items that you will need to take in order to protect the site:

* /www/ramequipment20_230/public/imagify-backup/wp-content/themes/revolution-child/incs/admin/option-tree/admin/assets/assets.php was infected. I've cleaned it manually but you may want to reinstall the theme 'revolution-child from the theme author to prevent re-infections.

* /www/ramequipment20_230/public/wp-content/plugins/jet-menu/integration/themes/Avada/assets/js/script.js was infected. I've cleaned it manually but you may want to reinstall the theme ' from the theme author to prevent re-infections.

* /www/ramequipment20_230/public/wp-content/plugins/jet-menu/integration/themes/twentysixteen/assets/js/script.js was infected. I've cleaned it manually but you may want to reinstall the theme ' from the theme author to prevent re-infections.

* /www/ramequipment20_230/public/wp-content/plugins/jet-menu/integration/themes/generatepress/assets/js/script.js was infected. I've cleaned it manually but you may want to reinstall the theme ' from the theme author to prevent re-infections.

* /www/ramequipment20_230/public/wp-content/plugins/jet-menu/integration/themes/storefront/assets/js/script.js was infected. I've cleaned it manually but you may want to reinstall the theme ' from the theme author to prevent re-infections.

* /www/ramequipment20_230/public/wp-content/plugins/jet-menu/integration/themes/twentyseventeen/assets/js/script.js was infected. I've cleaned it manually but you may want to reinstall the theme ' from the theme author to prevent re-infections.

* /www/ramequipment20_230/public/wp-content/plugins/jet-menu/integration/themes/enfold/assets/js/script.js was infected. I've cleaned it manually but you may want to reinstall the theme ' from the theme author to prevent re-infections.

* /www/ramequipment20_230/public/wp-content/plugins/jet-menu/integration/themes/astra/assets/js/script.js was infected. I've cleaned it manually but you may want to reinstall the theme ' from the theme author to prevent re-infections.

* /www/ramequipment20_230/public/wp-content/plugins/jet-menu/integration/themes/betheme/assets/js/script.js was infected. I've cleaned it manually but you may want to reinstall the theme ' from the theme author to prevent re-infections.

* /www/ramequipment20_230/public/wp-content/themes/astra-child/assets/js/share-link.min.js was infected. I've cleaned it manually but you may want to reinstall the theme 'astra-child from the theme author to prevent re-infections.

* The plugin 'google-sitemap-generator' was infected. Since it is not available on the WordPress workshop, I was unable to reinstall it. It has been deactivated/moved to private/suspected and should be reinstalled from the plugin author's website.

Below you will see a list of all WordPress users with administrator access to the site. Please review this list carefully and then log into your site and delete any administrators that are no longer needed or that you do not recognize:

As a preventative measure we have updated the WordPress salts in the wp-config.php file. This will have the effect of causing all users to be logged out of the site. So all users will have to log in the next time they access the site.

In addition, please note that the SFTP/SSH and database passwords have been changed. The next time you use SFTP/SSH or access phpMyAdmin you will need to use the updated passwords.

Backups within MyKinsta have been hidden to avoid restoring malware to our platform. If you require data from an old backup, please contact support.

We would ask that you take the following steps within the next 24 hours:

* Install any available updates to the WordPress core and the site's themes and plugins.

* Require all administrators to change their WordPress passwords.

* Require all MyKinsta users to change their passwords.

Known vulnerabilities in older versions of plugins, themes, and the WordPress core are a common point of entry for malicious activity. As a result, it is our policy that any site that has been infected with malware must have the WordPress core, as well as all plugins and themes updated to the latest version within 24 hours of repair. If this is not done the site will no longer be eligible for future free malware removal.

Please notify us as soon as updates have been applied so that we can update our records to reflect that all updates have been applied.

Finally, please note that we have disabled the theme and plugin editors in the WordPress admin area. While we recommend leaving these disabled permanently, if you do use them you can reenable them after all users have updated their passwords by removing these lines from your site's wp-config.php file:

##Disable Editing in Dashboard

define('DISALLOW_FILE_EDIT', true);

Let us know if you have any questions!
Reply in our Messenger

You may need to sign in to Kinsta again.

You can also reply directly to this email.
Adrian from Kinsta
